title: Request on behalf
content:
With the appropriate configuration, Service Management allows users in the Service Portal to create a request on behalf of another person. The feature is designed for two types of people: managers, and assistants.

There are the following types of request on behalf situations:

  • On behalf of an individual
  • On behalf of a member of a group: any one of the members of a specified group
  • By a manager, on behalf of someone who reports to the manager

This feature isn't available if you use a tablet, tablet PC, or a mobile phone to access Service Management.

How to set up request on behalf

On behalf of an individual

For user A to be able to create a request for user B:

  1. From the main menu, select Administration > Master Data > People > People.
  2. Select user A.
  3. Click the Request on behalf tab.
  4. In the Users section, click Add. Add user B.
  5. Click Save.

For more information, see Users and contacts and Request on behalf tab.

On behalf of a group member

For user A to be able to create a request for members of group G:

  1. From the main menu, select Administration > Master Data > People > People.
  2. Select user A.
  3. Click the Request on behalf tab.
  4. In the Group members section, click Add. Add group G.
  5. Click Save.

For more information, see Users and contacts and Request on behalf tab.

By a manager, on behalf of someone who reports to the manager

This functionality is automatically enabled if the people record of the employee is set up to specify the employee’s manager.

For example, when setting up user U who has a manager M:

  1. From the main menu, select Administration > Master Data > People > People.
  2. Select user U.
  3. In the General tab, Organizational information section, click the Manager drop-down.
  4. Select M from the list of managers.
  5. Click Save.

For more information, see Users and contacts and Request on behalf tab.

Universal request on behalf

You can configure this feature to allow any user to request on behalf of any other user.

If data segmentation isn't enabled, then after you enable Universal request on behalf, any end user in Service Portal will have access to the list of all users in the system.

To configure universal request:

  1. From the main menu, select Administration > Studio.

  2. In the drop-down at the top of the page, select Request.

  3. Click the Processes and Rules tab.

  4. Close the Workflow map.

  5. Click the Rules tab.

  6. In the Rendering forms section, click Add.

  7. Select Simple rule. The Set rule dialog box is displayed.
